oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SWASH MOTION DUE TO OBLIQUELY INCIDENT WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Asano, Toshiyuki
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: swash motion
oblique waves
incident waves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A numerical model is developed to predict the flow characteristics in a swash zone for obliquely incident wave trains. The two-dimensional shallow water equations are de-coupled into independent equations each for on-off shore motion and for longshore motion. A front of swash wave train is treated as a moving boundary which makes the solution predictable for landward zone of the still water level. The results show non-vanishing longshore velocities and volume flux at the still water shoreline. These quantities are found to increase with the beach slope. The two-dimensional uprush and downrush motion near the front of swash waves shows skew figures, which may cause zig-zag longshore sediment transport inherent in swash zone.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
